Build I200506091102

Reloading a genmodel from an ecore file is very broken.  Here are the details:

Select a genmodel, right click and select Reload...
Select EMF ecore model
Click Next
Nothing happens
Click Next
Error dialog appears saying that you need to select an ecore model
Dismiss the error dialog
The Model URI field will be empty - it used to contain the paths to the ecore files that were previously 
loaded
The Generator model file name field will be empty - it should default to the selected genmodel

If you fill in the Model URI, and the genmodel name, you can get to the next page
Select the packages, add the referenced generator models and select the appropriate referenced 
packages
Click Finish
You get a NPE


If you are able to reproduce this, any chance you could spin another integration build with the fix?

Bryan, 

No I can't reproduce this (in my develop environment nor in a fresh install of
RC1 and the latest EMF driver). It sounds to me like you have a bad installation. 
Have you tried running with -clean.  Note that we moved to using manifests in
this build, and some folks are seeing strange access errors and failures to load
classes when they update an existing installation.

If your problem persists with clean installation, please show the stack traces
in the .log and reopen the bugzilla.  We likely also need the sample files you
are reloading as well, i.e., the .genmodel and .ecore...

Bryan,

I encountered this problem:

!STACK 0

size=1

which reveals a long standing but in GenOperationImpl.initialize.

It's very easy to fix.  I'll reopen this bugzilla to fix it, I'll attach the
.class file so that you can patch your driver, and I'll downgrade the severity
since you'll have a workaround.

You also seem to have a broken Ecore reference from
prog/Program/execute/executionHarness to its type.

Created an attachment (id=22820)
Compiled fix for problem

This class can be used to patch org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.
The fix is commited to CVS.

I just installed the new integration build, and I've run into this problem
again.  It's with a different project/genmodel, but same error log.

My bad, I just realized that the latest download on the download page is not the
latest integration build.  It's one build behind.
